instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no charging
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that is not charging.
It has some signs of corrosion, but works fine on charger.
On battery doesn't work, and doesn't charge (but is recognized),.
Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no charging
threads.message:
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, w/ and w/o battery connected.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no charging
threads.message:
Hi,
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.27V (W/O battery)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  = 1.2V (W baterry)
SCL  = 0.566 mV
SDA = 0.555 mV

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no charging
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  = 1.2V (W baterry)"
I meant charger AND battery; not battery alone.

12.27V on charger alone, there is a communication problem between SMC and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Diode mode readings look good, post voltage on SCL/SDA too.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is good.
Try known good <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> chip.
If still the same, change SMC.

Just in case, test removing <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> first.
